item.title: Revisiting the Maximum Entropy Bootstrap
item.description: The basic bootstrap is a powerful and intuitive tool that can be used in many ways. The basic intuition is: given a random sample \(p\) from some population \(P\), we can resample from \(p\) with replacement to get a bootstrapped sample (letâ€™s call it \(p_{b}\)) that can be looked at as another sample from population \(P\); that is, without seeing any more observations within the population of interest, we can construct many samples \(p_b\) that approximate the overall population \(P\).
